heart_rate_monitor module¶

class heart_rate_monitor.ECGData(file_name, threshold_factor=0, user_input=0)¶

Bases: object

beats_times()¶

Function returns a numpy array of the times at which a beat occurred :returns self.beats: times at which beats occur

correlate_wavelet_dataset()¶

Function correlates wavelet with complete set of filtered data :returns self.correlted_data: numpy 1D array containing correlation data

duration()¶

Function returns time of ECG :returns max(self.time_dataset.values): time duration of ECG

find_max_voltage_index()¶

Function returns index at which the voltage value in the ECG numpy array is maximum :returns self.max_voltage_index: index at maximum voltage value

find_peaks(threshold_factor)¶

Function returns voltage at each beat :returns self.beat_voltage: array with voltages at beat

find_peaks_index()¶

Function returns index for each beat voltage :returns self.peaks_index: numpy 1D array containing correlated and positive data

get_wavelet()¶

Function obtains clipped part of the complete dataset that contains 60 voltage and time values :returns self.wavelet: clipped portion of the filtered, complete dataset containing 60 values

make_json(file_name)¶

Function returns json file containing all required ECG Data :param file_name: name of file for data to be extracted from

mean_hr_bpm(user_input)¶

Function returns average heart rate over user specified input :param user_input: time in minutes :returns self.hr: average heart rate in beats per second

moving_average()¶

Function takes numpy array with raw ECG information and performs a moving average function over it with a window of 10 :returns self.ma_dataset: numpy array after the moving average is performed

num_beats()¶

Function returns the number of beats that occurred :returns len(self.beat_voltage): length of numpy array

voltage_extremes()¶

Function returns maximum and minimum voltage values in ECG :returns self.max_min: tuple containing maximum and minimum voltage values
